alert.note: Alert for Macomb; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 8:53PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macomb and St. Clair Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Yale to near Capac to near Lum. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lakeport and Emmett around 905 PM EDT. Memphis around 915 PM EDT. Port Huron and Marysville around 920 PM EDT. Armada around 930 PM EDT. St. Clair around 935 PM EDT. Richmond around 940 PM EDT. New Baltimore around 950 PM EDT. Algonac and Marine City around 1000 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Anchorville, North Street, Roseville, Shelby Township, Lynn Township, Ray Center, Brockway, Utica, Washington and Fort Gratiot. People attending Jimmy Johns Field should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
